Citizenship.

Defined as ‚Äúthe quality of an individual‚Äôs response to membership in a community‚Äù

Over the past 24 hours I have seen incredible examples of people responding to the needs they see, hear and feel.

- Huge education companies are giving away their materials for free
- Comcast is extending internet service for FREE to those in our community who typically are unable to access service
- Museums, experts, and community organizations have moved their services online and are offering remote learning opportunities for students
- Friends, neighbors, relatives, colleagues and strangers are finding ways to check in on each other
- Local organizations are throwing their doors open wide and asking ‚Äúhow can we help?‚Äù

I am proud to call SPOKANE home every day, but especially proud right now. Find a way to lean in and help. And if anyone ever questioned why we believe so deeply in the core value of citizenship... this is why.

Koins for Ki‚ù§Ô∏èa in February:

Hello SIA community! As you know, SIA has a passion for partnering with Kiva.org to support entrepreneurs all over the world in their efforts to enrich the lives of those in their community. To date SIA's team has made over $5,000 in loans to more than 65 different countries!

This February we'd like to encourage our students to show their love for the world in a different way. We are asking all Middle Academy students to bring in spare change or paper money to their houses starting Monday Feb. 5th. Each house will be collecting money in a competition aimed at earning points towards the final tally, and the first ever winner of the MA House Cup challenge.

If you don't have a Middle Academy student and would just like to support our efforts, we encourage you to visit our Kiva team page, set up an account, and make your first loan today. When you loan, please make sure you have selected that it is applied to our team total.

The Northwest Museum of Arts & Culture
December 21, 2016 at 4:01 PM ¬∑

Wednesday is here again! Tonight the museum will be open three extra hours -- 8:00 PM.

Bring family and friends down for a fun night at the Museum during this holiday season. Lost Egypt: Ancient Secrets, Modern Science is only here until January 6th! Take a stab at building your own pyramid, play with wind and sands to see how different monuments get covered, and of course say hello to our resident mummy, Annie.

We also have two local artists on display; Linda Hyatt Cancel and Chris Bovey. Linda's work, The Rising, is located in Gallery B in our main exhibition building. This work is an artist in residency that Linda did at the Lake Roosevelt area and based around her family. Chris Bovey's, My Spokane!, is located in our Helen South Alexander Gallery in our Cheney Cowles Center. These are screen prints of local sites accompanied by archival photos of the subject matter.

General questions can be directed to our Visitor Services staff at 509 456 3931.

SIA CAT (Community Advisory Team):

Have you joined the Families of Spokane International Academy page on Facebook? This page helps parents to connect about uniforms, events, and activities for parents or students.

Also, if you are a parent or family member that would like to be involved in our CAT group (similar to a PTA), please email at cat@spokaneintlacademy.org. The CAT provides fundraising opportunities for items/projects that SIA cannot fund (playground equipment, teacher appreciation, etc.) This is a great way for you to support our kids and our teachers.
